name: Tangela
flavorText: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

name: Tangrowth
flavorText: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Pinsir
flavorText: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
Attack1Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

name: Spinarak
flavorText: Some fishers weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

name: Ariados
flavorText: It wanders in search of food after darkness falls, never nesting in a specific place.
Ability1Text: Your opponent's Active Evolution Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

name: Sunkern
flavorText: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Sunflora
flavorText: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 damage for each Fire Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Heracross
flavorText: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Volbeat
flavorText: It flashes the light on its rear to communicate with other Volbeat. It loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
Attack1Text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: If Illumise is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Illumise
flavorText: It guides Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. There are scholars who research the meaning of these signs.
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Shuffle 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck.

name: Leafeon
flavorText: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
Attack1Text: Attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, heal all damage from that Pokémon.

name: Phantump
flavorText: This Pokémon came to be when the spirit of a deceased child possessed a tree stump. It now wanders the forest searching for friends.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Trevenant
flavorText: Trevenant is very kind to Pokémon living in the forest. It doesn't even care if these Pokémon take up residence in the greenery on its head.
Attack1Text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Grookey
flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

name: Thwackey
flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if your Active Pokémon has the Festival Lead Ability, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Rillaboom
flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

name: Applin
flavorText: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Dipplin
flavorText: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.
Ability1Text: If Festival Grounds is in play, this Pokémon may use an attack it has twice. If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Iron Leaves
flavorText: According to the few eyewitness accounts that exist, it used its shining blades to julienne large trees and boulders.
Attack1Text: Put up to 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Poltchageist
flavorText: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokémon are entirely unrelated.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon.

name: Poltchageist
flavorText: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokémon are entirely unrelated.
Attack1Text: Put a Basic Grass Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Sinistcha
flavorText: It prefers cool, dark places, such as the back of a shelf or the space beneath a home's floorboards. It wanders in search of prey after sunset.
Attack1Text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: Discard up to 3 Grass Energy cards from your Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Sinistcha ex
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Basic Grass Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those Energy cards into your deck.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

name: Teal Mask Ogerpon
flavorText: This mischief-loving Pokémon is full of curiosity. It battles by drawing out the type-based energy contained within its masks.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Teal Mask Ogerpon ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw a card.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

name: Slugma
flavorText: It's said that in ancient times, when volcanoes were more active, there were many more Slugma than there are now.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Magcargo ex
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Discard the top card of each player's deck. This attack does 140 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

name: Torkoal
flavorText: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Chimchar
flavorText: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Monferno
flavorText: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Infernape
flavorText: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Fire Energy card, a Basic Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Darumaka
flavorText: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Darmanitan
flavorText: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

name: Litwick
flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life-force of any who follow it.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Lampent
flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Chandelure
flavorText: It absorbs spirits, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may have each player draw a card.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

name: Chi-Yu
flavorText: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 60 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium.

name: Hearthflame Mask Ogerpon ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 140 more damage, and discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Poliwag
flavorText: Its legs are newly grown, and it can't walk very well. It seems to prefer swimming through the water instead.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Poliwhirl
flavorText: Its skin is moist all over its body. The skin on its belly spiral also feels smooth.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: You may do 120 more damage. If you do, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
Ability1Text: If Festival Grounds is in play, this Pokémon may use an attack it has twice. If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Seaking
flavorText: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Jynx
flavorText: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. If you put any Pokémon onto your Bench in this way, move an Energy from this Pokémon to the new Benched Pokémon.

name: Corphish
flavorText: It can live in impure water, where it doesn't need to compete with other water Pokémon for food, so its numbers have steadily increased.

name: Crawdaunt
flavorText: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Feebas
flavorText: It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms schools and lives at the bottom of rivers that teem with plant life.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Milotic
flavorText: It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of war, it shows itself, which soothes people's minds and hearts.
Ability1Text: Your opponent's Pokémon in play and all attached cards can't be put into your opponent's hand.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: It is said that a home visited by a Snorunt will prosper. It can withstand cold of −150 degrees Fahrenheit.
Attack1Text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

name: Glalie
flavorText: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Froslass
flavorText: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
Ability1Text: During Pokémon Checkup, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon that has an Ability (both yours and your opponent's), except any Froslass.

name: Glaceon
flavorText: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
Attack1Text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, put 9 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Phione
flavorText: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
Attack1Text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Froakie
flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Froakie and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Frogadier
flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cramorant
flavorText: It's an incredibly poor learner because it uses the bare minimum amount of energy for its brain. It focuses on battling instead.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Finizen
flavorText: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Palafin
flavorText: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen's, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from the Active Spot to the Bench, you may search your deck for a Palafin ex and switch it with this Pokémon. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon. If you switched a Pokémon in this way, put this card into your deck. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Palafin ex
Ability1Text: Put this Pokémon into play only with the effect of Palafin's Zero to Hero Ability.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Iron Bundle
flavorText: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Walking Wake
flavorText: This ferocious creature is shrouded in mystery. It's named after an aquatic monster mentioned in an old expedition journal.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Put up to 9 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

name: Wellspring Mask Ogerpon ex
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.
Attack2Text: You may shuffle 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your deck. If you do, this attack also does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Zapdos
flavorText: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it's in trouble.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Luxio
flavorText: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

name: Luxray ex
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard a card you find there.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Emolga
flavorText: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Helioptile
flavorText: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Morpeko
flavorText: It has a small stomach. If it isn't constantly eating the seeds it keeps in its pockets, it will get hungry immediately.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top card of your deck. You may discard that card.
Attack1Text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Tadbulb
flavorText: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.

name: Bellibolt
flavorText: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt's belly-button dynamo.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Wattrel
flavorText: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they're a popular delicacy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Kilowattrel
flavorText: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There's hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Iron Thorns ex
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, Pokémon with a Rule Box in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities, except for Future Pokémon. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.

name: Clefable
flavorText: It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

name: Abra
flavorText: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra's dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may shuffle it and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Kadabra
flavorText: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Alakazam
flavorText: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. You may move any number of damage counters from your opponent's Pokémon to their other Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Girafarig
flavorText: Girafarig's tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon from behind.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Farigiraf
flavorText: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.
Attack1Text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Chimecho
flavorText: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
Attack2Text: Shuffle 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: This Flabébé rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokémon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Floette
flavorText: This Pokémon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Florges
flavorText: They say that flower gardens created by Florges are constantly showered with a power that can heal both body and spirit.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot, and the new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Swirlix
flavorText: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn't get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.
Ability1Text: If Festival Grounds is in play, this Pokémon may use an attack it has twice. If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Slurpuff
flavorText: By taking in a person's scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It's hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. If both of them are tails,  your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they're blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Palossand
flavorText: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Enamorus
flavorText: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
Attack2Text: If any of your Pokémon in play are the same type as any of your opponent's Pokémon in play, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Scream Tail ex
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Munkidori
flavorText: Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, you may move up to 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Fezandipiti
flavorText: Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokémon.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached and is damaged by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: No matter how high a place it falls from, this Pokémon can save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Sandslash
flavorText: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Hisuian Growlithe
flavorText: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.
Attack1Text: Discard a Stadium in play.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Hisuian Arcanine
flavorText: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.
Attack1Text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: When endangered, it may protect itself by increasing its magnetism and drawing nearby iron objects to its body.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Probopass
flavorText: Probopass radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances are rendered useless while it's around.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Timburr
flavorText: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle heavy lumber without difficulty.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Gurdurr
flavorText: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
Attack2Text: You may do 30 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Conkeldurr
flavorText: Rather than rely on their strength, they master moves that make good use of centrifugal force to swing around concrete.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, ignore all Energy in this attack's cost.

name: Greninja ex
Attack1Text: You may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Hawlucha
flavorText: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.
Attack1Text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Glimmet
flavorText: Glimmet's toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Glimmora
flavorText: Glimmora's petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Ting-Lu
flavorText: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.
Attack1Text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and discard that Stadium. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Okidogi
flavorText: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, it gets +100 HP, and the attacks it uses do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon ex
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage from attacks done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon that have an Ability.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Poochyena
flavorText: Poochyena pursue their prey in packs. Once the prey is exhausted, the pack finishes it off. But sometimes the prey retaliates, and the pack flees.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Mightyena
flavorText: Once it's caught the scent of faraway prey, the leader gives a signal, and the whole pack moves out.
Attack1Text: If Mightyena is on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

name: Venipede
flavorText: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Whirlipede
flavorText: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

name: Scolipede
flavorText: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws' toxic spikes.
Attack1Text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

name: Brute Bonnet
flavorText: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Skarmory
flavorText: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
Attack2Text: Discard a Stadium in play.

name: Aron
flavorText: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Lairon
flavorText: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Aggron
flavorText: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Heatran
flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack1Text: Discard all Metal Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Varoom
flavorText: The steel section is Varoom's actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.
Attack1Text: Attach a Basic Metal Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

name: Revavroom
flavorText: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

name: Applin
flavorText: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dipplin
flavorText: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.
Attack1Text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 70 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

name: Dreepy
flavorText: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn't feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

name: Drakloak
flavorText: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they're all grown up.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

name: Dragapult ex
Attack2Text: Put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Tatsugiri
flavorText: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal a Supporter card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Farfetch'd
flavorText: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Chansey
flavorText: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
Attack1Text: Attach a Basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Blissey ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may move a Basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesn't bother it at all.
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Aipom
flavorText: Its tail moves with greater dexterity than its hands. Making deft use of this tail, Aipom lives high among the treetops.

name: Ambipom
flavorText: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things that Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

name: Ducklett
flavorText: It strengthens its body by diving into the depths of ponds, swimming around while looking for bog moss to eat.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Swanna
flavorText: It's said that many artists have taken inspiration from the sight of a Swanna performing a beautiful dance in the light of dawn.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Bloodmoon Ursaluna ex
Ability1Text: Blood Moon used by this Pokémon costs Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Pinsir
flavorText: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
Attack1Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

name: Sunflora
flavorText: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 damage for each Fire Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Dipplin
flavorText: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.
Ability1Text: If Festival Grounds is in play, this Pokémon may use an attack it has twice. If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Poltchageist
flavorText: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokémon are entirely unrelated.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon.

name: Torkoal
flavorText: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Infernape
flavorText: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Fire Energy card, a Basic Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Froslass
flavorText: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
Ability1Text: During Pokémon Checkup, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon that has an Ability (both yours and your opponent's), except any Froslass.

name: Phione
flavorText: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
Attack1Text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Cramorant
flavorText: It's an incredibly poor learner because it uses the bare minimum amount of energy for its brain. It focuses on battling instead.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Wattrel
flavorText: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they're a popular delicacy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Chimecho
flavorText: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
Attack2Text: Shuffle 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Enamorus
flavorText: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
Attack2Text: If any of your Pokémon in play are the same type as any of your opponent's Pokémon in play, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Hisuian Growlithe
flavorText: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.
Attack1Text: Discard a Stadium in play.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Probopass
flavorText: Probopass radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances are rendered useless while it's around.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Timburr
flavorText: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle heavy lumber without difficulty.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Lairon
flavorText: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Applin
flavorText: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Tatsugiri
flavorText: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal a Supporter card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Chansey
flavorText: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
Attack1Text: Attach a Basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Sinistcha ex
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Basic Grass Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those Energy cards into your deck.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

name: Teal Mask Ogerpon ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw a card.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

name: Magcargo ex
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Discard the top card of each player's deck. This attack does 140 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

name: Hearthflame Mask Ogerpon ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 140 more damage, and discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Palafin ex
Ability1Text: Put this Pokémon into play only with the effect of Palafin's Zero to Hero Ability.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Wellspring Mask Ogerpon ex
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.
Attack2Text: You may shuffle 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your deck. If you do, this attack also does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Luxray ex
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard a card you find there.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Iron Thorns ex
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, Pokémon with a Rule Box in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities, except for Future Pokémon. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Scream Tail ex
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Greninja ex
Attack1Text: You may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cornerstone Mask Ogerpon ex
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage from attacks done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon that have an Ability.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Dragapult ex
Attack2Text: Put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Blissey ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may move a Basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

Ability1Text: Blood Moon used by this Pokémon costs Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw a card.

Attack2Text: You may shuffle 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your deck. If you do, this attack also does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

Ability1Text: Prevent all damage from attacks done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon that have an Ability.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

Ability1Text: Blood Moon used by this Pokémon costs Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.
